intro: Haplophyllum fruticulosum, commonly known as the hairy leaf plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, hairy fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Haplophyllum fruticulosum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
